_header: The number of Jesu Christs wounds
Subjects: Christ, wounds of; devotional verse; illustrations, verse accompanying; Christ, wounds of; crucifixion
_description: The number of the Wounds of Christ and the number of the Drops of Blood from these Wounds — nine lines

BodDou1.First Lines:
The numbre of the droppes of blodethat Ihesu Criste shed for
                    manhode …
BodDou1.Last Lines:
…ffyue thousande also grete and smallHere is the nombre of
                    them all
BodDou1.Note:
Six lines only and omits mention of Wounds; written as
                    prose.
BodDou1.Attributed Title: Thus endeth the prayers of the passion of oure lorde (at the end)

BodLatMisC66.Transcription:
Fyve thowsande & iiii hundrethiii score & fiftene ffull
                    grithewere goddis woundis to safe vs wyth
BodLatMisC66.Note:
Written above heart illustrating the wounds Christ received on the
                    cross; 3 lines monorhyming.

BodTan407.First Lines:
The novmbre of thes dropes all I wyll reherse in generall
                    …
BodTan407.Last Lines:
…Vc also gret & smallHere is the nombre of hem
                    alle
BodTan407.Note: Six lines only and omits mention of Wounds.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
The nombre of these dropys allffyue hundred thousand for to
                    tellAnd seuen & fourty thousand well…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…ffyue hundred also gret & smallHere ys þe nombre of
                    hem all
CamTCC601.Note:
Follows immediately 2419; six lines only and omits mention of
                    Wounds.

BLAdd37049.Transcription:
The nowmer of Jhesu Cristes wowndesAr fyve thowsande foure hondreth
                    sexty and fyfteeneThe whilk in his body war felt and sene
BLAdd37049.Editions:
Comper,  Frances M. M. 
             The Life of Richard Rolle, Together with an Edition of his English
                Lyrics.
         London: J. M. Dent, 1928, 1933; New York: E. P. Dutton, 1929: 318.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 401; 1977, 409 (3 lines only).
Doty,  Brant Lee,
                        ed.  
             “An Edition of British Museum MS Additional 37049: a Religious
                Miscellany.” 
         Diss. Michigan State, 1969: 156.
